<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set the action of a control of the currently active user dialog. The script statement is executed on button release and <tt>_this</tt> is available, but contains ""; See [[Arma: GUI Configuration]] for more information about user dialogs. Works with:
* CT_BUTTON
* CT_XBUTTON
* CT_ACTIVETEXT
* CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Warning </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> The action code is expected to be in '''[[SQS]]''' format</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''buttonSetAction''' [idc, action]
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [idc, action]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> idc: [[Number]] - control ID
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> action: [[String]] - [[SQS]] code body that should be executed when the button/active text is clicked
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> control '''buttonSetAction''' action

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> control:  [[Control]] - button control
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> action:  [[String]] - [[SQS]] code body that should be executed when the button/active text is clicked
</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[buttonSetAction]] [100, "[[player]] [[exec]] ""reply.sqs"""];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_ctrl [[buttonSetAction]] "[[if]] ([[alive]] bob) [[then]] {[[hint]] 'alive'} [[else]] {[[hint]] 'dead'}"; // SQF but SQS compatible, see [[SQS]]</code>
</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Script is SQS<code>_control [[buttonSetAction]] "[[hint]] [[format]] ['Is SQS: %1', ![[isNil]] '_time']";</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[buttonAction]], [[ctrlActivate]]
</value></part></template>

<dt class="note">[[User:Kungtotte|kungtotte]]<dd class="note">
When using buttonSetAction for an ActiveText control from a script, you cannot use any variables local to the script in it.
<ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner><nowiki>
/* This will print 'any bar' in the hint box,
 since _foo has no value according to buttonSetAction */

_foo = "foo";
buttonSetAction [100, "hint format[""%1 bar"", _foo];"];</nowiki></inner><close></pre></close></ext>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

To use variables local to the defining script, a syntax like the one below needs to be used:
<code>_foo = "foo";
buttonSetAction [100, format["hint '%1 bar'", _foo]];
</code>
works! thanks to Kronzky for commenting this workaround in the VBS wiki
